intro: Gonolobus waitukubuliensis, commonly known as the Waitakere dandelion, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in disturbed soils. It has small, heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
